text: I am one of the unfortunate 5% of kidney stone sufferers who have suffered from uric acid kidney stones. My urologist had prescribed me a 1000 mg. potassium citrate pill, timed release, 1 per day but then my insurance informed me this prescription product was no longer covered and I would need to pay $80 per month for it. (Potassium citrate changes the ph of urine and prevents kidney stone formation.) I decided to go with this product, 4 capsules morning and evening, and I've used this in lieu of the prescription stuff for about 3 years now and have not had any kidney stone attacks. I informed my urologist of this fact and he's noted it to recommend to others who may be in need of this product. This has worked for me and, anecdotally, I endorse it as a solution for this purpose as it has saved me over $2K in expense over the last few years. As always, YMMV.
